alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 5:57AM EDT until March 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Black River At Watertown affecting Lewis and Jefferson Counties. For the Black River...including Watertown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Watertown. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flood stage, farmland flooding begins in the Flats with some roads flooded. Minor damages to riverfront commercial properties in Dexter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 10.1 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 03/29/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EDT.
